newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts strive to overcome 115-00 area.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts strive to overcome 115-00 area.

text.p: Gilts look technically stronger after recent consolidation and a break above 115-00 should be the trigger for a further push higher, technical analysts said on Thursday.
September gilts set a contract high at 115-05 on July 2, a high of 115-02 on July 7, and a high of 115-00 on July 11.

"Gilts are stuck in a strait-jacket of 115-00 and 114-00," said a technical analyst at a European bank in London. "On balance it looks bullish and a close above 115-00 should be worth a point-and-a-half."
September gilt futures were up 5/32 at 114-19 by 0705 GMT.

While the momentum remained neutral, with the 14-day Relative Strength Index at around 56 percent, the analyst said a break out of a triangle formation at the beginning of July had yet to fulfill its potential.
"You have to sit with the positive," he said. "It's a bit of a test of patience, but it should be worth it."
He said the positive picture would be negated if the market closed below 114-00, which would target the 112-16 area.
Initial support was placed at 114-09/10, the middle of the range traded on Wednesday. Analysts at HSBC Futures said a break of 113-24 would open the way to trendline support at 113-14.
A trendline joining the lows of 112-02 on May 22, 112-05 on May 28 and 112-25 on June 24 comes in around the 113-14 area.
According to HSBC, penetrations of this would confirm the bearish arguments, targeting 112-00 over a relatively short period.
December short sterling futures were up 0.02 at 92.66. The European bank analyst said the market has stabilised, and is gearing up for a push to the upside.
